snippet: In northern Arkansas, people whose post offices are on a list of more than 3,600 being considered for closing have mounted campaigns to defend their communities’ lifelines.
abstract: Some 3,600 post offices across the country have been deemed by the United States Postal Service to have too little workload to justify keeping them open, as agency is facing billions of dollars in debt and a steadily declining revenue stream; communities have begun to mount aggressive campaigns to protest closures, and have exerted enough political pressure to cause Congress to persuade the postal service to declare a temporary moratorium on closures.
lead_paragraph: In northern Arkansas, people whose post offices are on a list of more than 3,600 being considered for closing have mounted campaigns to defend their communities’ lifelines.

headline.seo: Tiny Arkansas Towns Fight for Post Offices, and Survival
headline.main: A Fight for Post Offices and Towns’ Souls
